s1: This course covers a range of concepts, techniques and technologies in network security.

s1: This course covers a range of concepts, techniques and technologies in network security.
s2: In this course, you will learn fundamental concepts of data communication and networking in addition to gaining a working knowledge of network scalability, mobility, security, and managing capabilities.

s1: This includes an overview of relevant network protocols and cryptography; analyses of designs and implementations of security protocols, including basic tools and techniques; an understanding of network threats and attacks such as eavesdropping, spoofing, protocol failures, DoS attacks and man-in-the-middle attacks; network defence including threat analysis and identification, architecture control, intrusion detection and layered security.
s2: You will have the foundational basis to understand, evaluate, and compare new technologies and their applications.
